description: ESA SPACE-SHIELD Tactics adapted to SCOR namespace for matrix rendering in MISP.
name: SCOR SPACE-SHIELD Tactics

values.description: Gather information about the targeted system to identify critical assets, weakest links, and exploitable surfaces. Includes RF/optical interception and in-orbit intelligence.
Establish resources to support operations, including infrastructure, tooling, compromised accounts, and capabilities.
Gain an initial foothold in the targeted space system or ground segment, often through compromised ground systems, trusted relationships, or RF link exploitation.
Run adversary-controlled or malicious commands or code within spacecraft or ground systems to achieve specific goals.
Maintain undetected access over time through methods such as backdoors, pre-launch insertion, or credential persistence.
Obtain higher-level permissions or control, for example by becoming bus master or escaping virtualization boundaries.
Avoid detection or neutralize defensive measures by impairing defenses, removing indicators, or masquerading activity.
Steal or obtain credentials, including TT&C master/session keys or authentication tokens, through brute force, interception, or key recovery.
Gain knowledge about system structure, configuration, services, and trust relationships to inform further actions.
Move to other components or subsystems through compromised partitions, payload-platform pivots, or relay mechanisms.
Gather and centralize data from compromised assets, typically through link interception or adversary-in-the-middle operations.
Exfiltrate data through TM/payload channels, leveraging the broad RF footprint of space downlinks or optical links.
Establish and maintain communication channels with compromised space or ground systems to orchestrate operations.
Disrupt, degrade, or destroy the targeted system, its services, or physical platform through kinetic, electromagnetic, or operational effects.
